required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Serial Body Composition Change for Risk Prediction in Treating Patients With Severe Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Serial Body Composition Change for Risk Prediction in Treating Patients With Severe Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: We hypothesize that serial changes of body composition in patients with pneumonia can help clinician to monitor prognosis. It was associated with underlying immune response.

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific aims:
1. Can serial body composition data be useful for predicting outcomes of patients with pneumonia? (developing sepsis, organ failure, admission to ICU, length of ICU, survival, length of stay in hospital, prolonged mechanical ventilation,..)
2. Can serial body composition data be integrated into both immune status alternatives (e.g., white blood cell (WBC) count, segment/monocyte ratio, pulse pressure) in such critical illness and monitoring responses (SOFA score, labs) for severe pneumonia patients?
3. Can serial body composition data reflect clinical variables in patients with pneumonia, and even altered by nutrition intake? (e.g., compare association between nutrition intake amount and groups stratified by body composition, blood pressure, nutritional intake, …)

primary_outcome.time_frame: During hospitalization， "through study completion, an average of 1 year"
During hospitalization， "through study completion, an average of 1 year"
Change from Baseline Total Body Water at day 8

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Body Fat
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Percentage of Body Fat at day 8
primary_outcome.description: Change in Percentage of Body Fat

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Soft Lean Mass at day 8
Change from Baseline Segment count to monocyte count ratio at day 8
primary_outcome.description: Change in Segment count to monocyte count ratio

intervention.description: By means of noninvasively Bio-electrical Impedance Analysis (BIA) to measure body composition, which divides body weight into different components such as lean body mass and fat mass.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with pneumonia admitted to the thoracic ward or medical intensive care unit of the Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Adult patients with pneumonia admitted to the thoracic ward or medical intensive care unit of Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
-
